info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 18 at 11:03AM MDT until March 18 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Northern El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 200 PM MDT.
* At 1102 AM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Sunland Park, moving northeast at 45 mph. Thicker dust will be moving out of northern Chihuahua over the next couple of hours.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging winds in excess of 50 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico near mile marker 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 35. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 19.
Locations impacted include... Homestead Meadows, Vinton, Biggs Field, Chaparral, East El Paso, Franklin Mountains State Park, West El Paso, Canutillo, Westway, Fort Bliss, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Butterfield, Mission Valley, Hueco Mountain Estates, Sunland Park, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal, Fort Bliss Northeast, Central El Paso, and Anthony Gap.
info.instruction:
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 2:00 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 2:00 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; El Paso, TX

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 2:00 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 2:00 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Otero, NM; El Paso, TX
